parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
